title: Abu al-Jud
summary: Abū al-Jūd Muḥammad b. Aḥmad b. al-Layth was an Iranian mathematician who lived during 10th century and was a contemporary of Al-Biruni. He used conics to solve quartic and cubic equations, a century before the more famous work of Omar Khayyam,[1] although his solution did not deal with all the cases.[2]
